seccommerce.xml.dsig
Class XPathTransformFilter

java.lang.Object
  seccommerce.xml.dsig.XPathTransformFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class XPathTransformFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Signatures transform filter. It defines how an XML node set is transformed before a hash value for signature generation is computed for it. An XML-Transform-Filter consists of a transformation method, an XPath-expression and optional XPath-mappings. Allowed transformation methods are intersect, subtract and union. The XPath-mappings consists of a namespacename and its URI and they are inserted as a namespacedecalartion attribute in the XPath-element. Before signing the XPath-transform-filters are applied to the document in the order of its appearance. 

 cf. http://www.w3.org/2002/06/xmldsig-filter2
 cf. http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/#sec-XPath

 <element name="XPath" type="xf:XPathType"/>

  <complexType name="XPathType">
   <simpleContent>
     <extension base="string">
       <attribute name="Filter">
          <simpleType>
            <restriction base="string">
              <enumeration value="intersect"/>
              <enumeration value="subtract"/>
              <enumeration value="union"/>
            </restriction>
          </simpleType>
       </attribute>
     </extension>
   </simpleContent>
  </complexType>


 Example:
 <ds:Transform Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2002/06/xmldsig-filter2">
     <dsig-xpath:XPath xmlns:dsig-xpath="http://www.w3.org/2002/06/xmldsig-filter2" Filter="intersect">
         /descendant::*[local-name()='UNSVorlageLayer'][@*[local-name()='ATBRolle']='BEF'][@*[local-name()='ATBBefLfdNummer']=1][last()-0]
     </dsig-xpath:XPath>
 </ds:Transform>

Version:
$Id: XPathTransformFilter.java,v 1.16 2010/08/15 17:28:17 tk Exp $
